SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterfaceServer, Remote
public class Server extends Object implements InterfaceServer
The Server class represents the server component of the game application. This class manages the connection and communication with clients, handles game logic, and updates clients with the latest game state.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method of the server. It initializes and starts the RMI and TCP servers, listens for incoming client connections, and manages the server shutdown.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments use to set Server properties

      Returns:
      True if the port number was successfully parsed, false otherwise

    • sendParameters

      public void sendParameters(InterfaceClient cl, int maxPlayerNumber, boolean onlyOneCommonCard) throws RemoteException
      Sends the lobby parameters to the client and handles the lobby creation process.
      Specified by:
      sendParameters in interface InterfaceServer
      Parameters:
      cl - The client interface (GUI o CLI)
      maxPlayerNumber - The maximum number of players allowed in the lobby
      onlyOneCommonCard - A boolean indicating if there will be one common card or two common cards
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote error occurs during the process

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove(Body move) throws RemoteException
      Executes the move received from the client and updates the game state.
      Specified by:
      executeMove in interface InterfaceServer
      Parameters:
      move - The move object representing the player's move
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If the move is invalid by the game rules

      public void clearRMI() throws RemoteException

      Specified by:

      Throws:
      RemoteException - A throw message used for ping purpose.

    • startCheckThreadRMI

      public void startCheckThreadRMI()
      Starts the check thread for RMI clients. This method starts a separate thread that periodically checks the connectivity of RMI clients. If a client is no longer reachable, it is disconnected and removed from the client map.

    • disconnectLastRMIUser

      public void disconnectLastRMIUser()
      Disconnects the last RMI client.
